<details><summary>Edit file: assets/style-3.css</summary>

I'm adding CSS styling for paper titles to make them look more clickable with color, cursor pointer, and hover effects

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 30, lines removed: undefined

```diff
@@ -272,2 +272,32 @@
      border-top-color: #ddd;
  }
+ 
+ /* Paper title styling to make them look clickable */
+ .papertitle {
+     color: #0066cc;
+     font-weight: 500;
+     text-decoration: none;
+     cursor: pointer;
+     transition: all 0.2s ease;
+ }
+ 
+ .papertitle:hover {
+     color: #004499;
+     text-decoration: underline;
+ }
+ 
+ /* Alternative styling for a more modern look */
+ .papertitle.modern {
+     color: #2c5aa0;
+     font-weight: 600;
+     text-decoration: none;
+     padding: 2px 4px;
+     border-radius: 3px;
+     transition: all 0.2s ease;
+ }
+ 
+ .papertitle.modern:hover {
+     background-color: #f0f8ff;
+     color: #1a4480;
+     text-decoration: none;
+ }
```

</details>

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>Perfect! I've added CSS styling that will make the paper titles look more clickable. Now the paper titles will:

1. Have a blue color (#0066cc) instead of default black text
2. Have a pointer cursor when hovering
3. Have medium font weight (500) to make them stand out slightly
4. Have a smooth transition effect
5. Change to a darker blue on hover with underline

I also added an alternative "modern" style that adds a subtle background on hover instead of underline, in case the user wants to try that.

The changes should make it immediately obvious that the paper titles are clickable links, even without hovering. The blue color is a standard link color that users will recognize as clickable.</details></think>

---

Perfect! I've added CSS styling to make your paper titles look clearly clickable. Here's what I've added to your `style-3.css` file:

## What Changed:
1. **Blue color**: Paper titles now have a blue color (#0066cc) instead of black text
2. **Pointer cursor**: Shows a hand cursor when hovering over titles  
3. **Medium font weight**: Makes titles stand out more (font-weight: 500)
4. **Smooth transitions**: Nice hover effects with color changes
5. **Hover underline**: Still shows underline on hover but now with a darker blue

## The Styling:
```css
.papertitle {
    color: #0066cc;
    font-weight: 500;
    text-decoration: none;
    cursor: pointer;
    transition: all 0.2s ease;
}

.papertitle:hover {
    color: #004499;
    text-decoration: underline;
}
```

Now your paper titles will immediately look like clickable links with the familiar blue color that users expect from links, while maintaining a clean appearance. The titles will be clearly distinguishable from regular text and users won't have to guess whether they can click on them.

I also included an alternative "modern" style (`.papertitle.modern`) that uses a subtle background highlight instead of underlines if you want to try that approach later!
